message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.OS, cs.SY, cs.DS

The paper discusses a new bare-metal cloud service that uses network-mounted boot drives to overcome the disadvantages of existing bare-metal cloud services. This involves a combination of distributed systems, networking, and operating systems. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also discusses the use of network-mounted boot drives, which involves networking and network protocols, making cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) a likely category as well. The paper also discusses the architecture and implementation of the system, which involves operating systems, making cs.OS (Operating Systems) a likely category. The paper also discusses the agility, scalability, and performance of the system, which involves system-level design and optimization, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a likely category. Finally, the paper discusses the comparison of M2 with existing systems, which involves performance evaluation and benchmarking, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a likely category as well.
